lines.content: Duke is a desktop app for managing different tasks. It is optimized to be used via a Command Line Interface. Made for users who are comfortable typing and using the Command Line.
1. Ensure you have Java 11 or above installed in your computer
1. Copy the file to the folder you want to use as the home folder for the task manager
1. Navigate to the folder with the .jar file
> * Words in upper case are parameters to be input by the user
> * items in square brackets [] are optional
> * Parameters have to be input in the order mentioned
Shows all the possible commands the use can enter.
Includes the format in which the user has to enter data.
Adds a todoTask to the task list.
Adds a task with a deadline to the task list.
* Time is entered in 24 hr format
Adds an event to the task list.
* Time is entered in 24 hr format
Deletes a task from the list
* Deletes the task in the tasklist with the specified `INDEX`
* `INDEX` has to be a positive integer within the range of the number of tasks
* *Tip:* use the `list` function to find the index of the task to delete
Changes a task status from incomplete to complete
* Edits the task in the tasklist with the specified `INDEX`
* `INDEX` has to be a positive integer within the range of the number of tasks
* *Tip:* use the `list` function to find the index of the task to edit
Shows all the tasks currently stored in the list
Shows all the tasks with descriptions that contain the keyword/phrase entered
* The word does not have to match exactly as long as it is part of the description e.g `birth` will match `birthday`
* `find Net` returns `2. [E][X] Networking session  (at: 26 DECEMBER 2020 02:30 PM)`
* `find Submit assign` returns `1. [D][Done] Submit assignment (by: 06 NOVEMBER 2020 11:59 PM)`
Shows all the tasks that are due/happening in the current day
* List only the deadlines and event occuring on that day
* If the current day is 2020-11-06, returns `1. [D][Done] Submit assignment (by: 06 NOVEMBER 2020 11:59 PM)`
Shows all the tasks that are due/occuring in the given month
* If no index has been input, it will return the tasks in the current month
* Index has to be an integer between 0 and 12 (inclusive of both)
* Index of value 0 will return the tasks in the current month
* Index of value 1 to 12 will return tasks in that given month. e.g `Index = 1` returns tasks in month of `JANUARY`
Shows all the tasks that are due/occuring in the given year
* If no index has been input, it will return the tasks in the current year
* Index has to be a positive integer
* Index of value 0 will return the tasks in the current year
Data of the tasks is automatically saved and updated in the hard disk after any command that changes the data.
**Q**: How do I transfer data from my computer to another
**A**: Follow the steps in the quick start. Copy the file "tasklist.txt" into the new folder on the new computer
**Q**: Can I edit the time of the event once I have added it
**A**: Unfortunately, currently the only way to do so is by deleting the event and adding a new event with the updated details
deadline | deadline DESCRIPTION by YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM
event | deadline DESCRIPTION by YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM

* Prints out all the commands that the user can enter

"done x: marks the task with index x as done\n" +
"delete x: deletes the task with index x\n" +
"todo description of task: adds a todo task with a description of the task\n" +
"deadline description by yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM : this adds a task with a deadline\n" +
"event description at yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM : this adds an event at a certain date.\n"+
"find x: finds a task with x as a keyword\n" +
"today: lists all the tasks occuring on that given day\n"+
"month x: lists all the tasks in the month of x (integer). If no x is added it shows the task in the current month\n"+
"year x: lists all the tasks in the year x, if no year is entered it shows the tasks in the current year\n";

* DukeException represents exceptions that are unique to Duke
* It stores the error message to be shown to the user
* Returns a string that describes the reason for the DukeException being thrown
* @return the error message that is to be displayed
* Represents work that has to be done by a certain deadline. A Task object corresponds to
* a task represented using a string for the description of it eg CS2113 tutorial
* a Boolean to keep track of whether it has been completed
* a LocalDate format of yyyy-mm-dd to store the date the task is due
* a localTime 24hr format of HH:MM to store the time the task is due
public Deadline(String description, LocalDate date, LocalTime time){
return String.format("[D][%s] %s(by:%s %s)", getStatusIcon(), description, dateToString(), timeToString());
return String.format("D:%s:%s:%s:%s", isDone, description, date.toString(), time.toString());
* Returns a String of the date in the format of dd MONTH (in words) yyyy which defers from the input format
* Returns a string in the 12hour clock format with the relevant am/pm period
* Represents work that has to be done by a certain deadline. A Task object corresponds to
* a task represented using a string for the description of it eg CS2113 tutorial
* a Boolean to keep track of whether it has been completed
* a LocalDate format of yyyy-mm-dd to store the date the event is taking place
* a localTime 24hr format of HH:MM to store the time the event is starting
public Event(String description, LocalDate date, LocalTime time){
return String.format("[E][%s] %s(at:%s %s)", getStatusIcon(), description, dateToString(), timeToString());
return String.format("E:%s:%s:%s:%s", isDone, description, date.toString(), time.toString());
* Returns a String of the date in the format of dd MONTH (in words) yyyy which defers from the input format
* Returns a string in the 12hour clock format with the relevant am/pm period
* Represents work that has to be done. A Task object corresponds to
* a task represented using a string for the description of it eg CS2113 tutorial
* and a Boolean to keep track of whether it has been completed
* Returns a String of the task with the format of "[isDone] description"
* Returns a string of the task information
* Formatted with : between each new piece of information
* Use this format to save it to storage
* Returns a String of the icon to be shown to the user when printing the task
